meanings.definition: The state or quality of being solemn.
meanings.sent1: The solemnities of the church service brought a sense of peace and reverence.
meanings.sent2: The family gathered for the solemnities of the funeral, paying their respects to the departed.
meanings.sent3: The solemnities of the cat wearing a tiny hat made everyone chuckle at the unexpected sight.
meanings.sent4: The solemnities of nature's beauty enveloped the hiker in a calming embrace.
meanings.sent5: The solemnities of the courtroom added gravity to the proceedings, reminding all of the seriousness of the situation.

meanings.definition: A solemn or formal ceremony or observance.
meanings.sent1: The graduation solemnities included speeches and the awarding of diplomas.
meanings.sent2: The royal family attended the solemnities of the coronation, a grand event steeped in tradition.
meanings.sent3: The solemnities of the penguin parade at the zoo delighted visitors of all ages.
meanings.sent4: The solemnities of the wedding ceremony united the couple in a bond of love and commitment.
meanings.sent5: The solemnities of the military funeral honored the fallen soldier with dignity and respect.
